Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 2.4 Å (window size, considering Van der Waals radii), 5.6 Å (octahedral cages), 4.7 Å (tetrahedral cages)

Other Information.Additional Info: N2 physisorption revealed a type II isotherm, indicative of non-porous or macroporous behavior.
H2 adsorption capacity was 35.6 cm³·g⁻¹ at 1 bar and 77 K, showing type I isotherm indicative of micropore filling.

Sieving Mechanism: Defect-induced modulation of pore windows through incorporation of acetate modulator.

Experimental Validation.Method: N2 and H2 physisorption isotherms, FTIR, TGA, 1H-NMR
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: H2 uptake: 35.6 cm³·g⁻¹ at 77 K and 1 bar, No N2 uptake observed

Other Information.Additional Info: Incorporation of acetate modulator creates accessible microporosity in an otherwise theoretically non-porous material.

Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 2.4 Å (window size, considering Van der Waals radii), 5.6 Å (octahedral cages), 4.7 Å (tetrahedral cages)

Other Information.Additional Info: N2 physisorption showed a type I isotherm with micropore uptake of 40.4 cm³·g⁻¹.
H2 adsorption capacity was 50.5 cm³·g⁻¹ at 1 bar and 77 K, showing type I isotherm indicative of micropore filling.

Sieving Mechanism: Defect-induced modulation of pore windows through incorporation of formate modulator; potential tilting of cluster-bound formates acting as trapdoors to increase window size.

Experimental Validation.Method: N2 and H2 physisorption isotherms, FTIR, TGA, 1H-NMR
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: N2 uptake: 40.4 cm³·g⁻¹, H2 uptake: 50.5 cm³·g⁻¹ at 77 K and 1 bar, BET surface area: 179 m²·g⁻¹

Other Information.Additional Info: Formate modulator incorporation increases porosity by altering the size and shape of triangular windows while suffering less steric hindrance compared to acetate.
